history.content: Our published class list contains all courses we know we're offering next semester.

I've heard from various students in the robotics lab that Sergey Levine is planning to teach the deep learning class next semester.

I don't think it makes sense that they are teaching like 15 sections now and only 1 for next semester. I think they're going to update their schedules.

I've heard from various students in the robotics lab that Sergey Levine is planning to teach the deep learning class next semester.

I don't think it makes sense that they are teaching like 15 sections now and only 1 for next semester. I think they're going to update their schedules.

Also, I think the instructors' responses on this EECS 101 page tend to be very "politically correct" and I don't think many students appreciate that. While I personally appreciate their efforts, they always tend to give us discouraging answers like "it depends" or "it is what it is" or "this class is full so give up" and that isn't really helpful at the end of the day. I've found that in reality, most of their responses don't even hold true.

I've heard from various students in the robotics lab that Sergey Levine is planning to teach the deep learning class next semester.

I don't think it makes sense that they are teaching like 15 sections now and only 1 for next semester. I think they're going to update their schedules.

children.subject: @Anon answerer: You realize that sp17 is the semester that is ending, not next semester, right?

history.content:
Hi,

I was wondering whether there are going to be more CS 294 classes added to the course list next semester? Currently on this site: https://www2.eecs.berkeley.edu/Scheduling/CS/schedule-next.html there is only one, and this semester, there were quite a few, so I was wondering whether more would be added later?
history.subject: Spring 2017 CS 294 Classes Finalized?
